meanings.definition: A small, high-pitched sound made by a bird.
meanings.sent1: The peetweets of the robin filled the garden with music.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the cheerful peetweets of the sparrows outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The peetweets of the chickadee sounded like a tiny orchestra tuning up.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the delicate peetweets of a hidden bird.
meanings.sent5: The peetweets of the finch were so sweet, they seemed to dance in the air.

meanings.definition: To make a small, high-pitched sound like a bird.
meanings.sent1: She would peetweets softly to call the birds to her hand.
meanings.sent2: The children giggled and tried to peetweets like the canaries in the pet store.
meanings.sent3: The old man would peetweets to himself when he was lost in thought.
meanings.sent4: Her voice could peetweets with joy, just like a bird in spring.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the branches peetweets as it rustled through the leaves.

meanings.definition: The act of making a small, high-pitched sound like a bird.
meanings.sent1: Her imitation of the bird's peetweets was surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent2: The peetweets of the children playing in the park blended with the birdsong.
meanings.sent3: The peetweets of the kitten trying to meow like a bird made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The peetweets of the flute echoed the call of the distant birds.
meanings.sent5: The peetweets of the wind chimes in the breeze mimicked the birds in the trees.
